column3: You will need to rebase on current master
> You will need to rebase on current master\n\n@MarcoFalke can you please guide me on how to do it properly I don't know how some errors occurred.

You can use a search engine to find out how to rebase with git: https://duckduckgo.com/?q=how+to+use+git

As the changes are small, I'd just reset the branch and start fresh: (Use at your own risk)

```
git checkout add-hyper-install.md
git fetch origin a5d00d4baff27b4185ea086af571142af17c32e4
git reset --hard a5d00d4baff27b4185ea086af571142af17c32e4
```

Then recreate the comm
@MarcoFalke now you can check, look like everything is now finally okðŸ˜­\n

The commit message "Added repo-relative link" is a bit confusing to people who just browse the change history. In general, try to make it interpretable independent of context or PR discussion history.\n\nChanges ACK 53b3bb5e09b02e4257de9868c2b0c98c2b97e2b9

> The commit message "Added repo-relative link" is a bit confusing to people who just browse the change history. In general, try to make it interpretable independent of context or PR discussion history.
> 
> Changes ACK [53b3bb5](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/53b3bb5e09b02e4257de9868c2b0c98c2b97e2b9)

@laanwj Noted. BTW when it will get merged?
> @laanwj Noted. Do I need to change anything?\n\nWell I mean you can change it quite easily `git commit --amend`, force-push. Change it, say, to the same as what the PR title now is.
@MarcoFalke @laanwj ,\nLook like all the checks have been passed, now we can merge?

- Please use a repo-relative link instead, don't want to either hardcode `bitcoin/bitcoin` or the branch `master` here
- Please use markdown link syntax
e.g. something like this should work, i think
```[doc/build-\*.md](/doc)```

```suggestion
See [doc/build-\*.md](/doc).
```

I think the whole file can be replaced by a simple <See link>. Though, that might just be me.
